introduction.description: Pantry, take away, delivery are integrated in our office's routine and whether on an individual level or an organisation level, we can limit our environmental impact with minimal effort.
introduction.focus: This section is mostly about raising awareness and reducing waste, including single-use items - such as but not limited to plastic: bags, cutlery, packaging...
introduction.reference: Check out the BYO (Bring Your Own) Campaign launched in 2017 by Zero Waste SG. So far, 2.5 million pieces of plastic disposables were avoided through the campaign.

solutions.title: Measure & Monitor
solutions.principle: If you don't measure it, you can't manage it!
actions: Start recording your food and drinks consumption/ waste
Implement a proper procedure to measure across all departments
Set annual reduction targets of food and drinks consumption/ waste to achieve environmental sustainability, economic outcomes and food security

solutions.title: Reduce F&B Consumption
ideas: Avoid over-ordering F&B for meetings, workshops, trainings, events. It is usually sufficient to order for 10–15% less than the number of guests attending.
Serve tap-water in reusable glass bottles
Make sure to share the leftovers with others or offer to take them home

solutions.title: Encourage Tap Water Consumption
solutions.singapore_context: Singapore's tap water is perfectly safe to drink without any further filtration. You can add a filter to the tap water if you wish.

solutions.title: Install Drinking Water Dispensers
solutions.preference: Prefer pipe-in Water Dispensers. Direct piping dispensers are plastic bottleless and typically connected to the water source (piped-in) in the office, with/ without filter.

solutions.title: Bags: Give up Single-Use
actions: Create a 'bags box' for employees for their take-away lunch or other purchase. To do so, collect existing bags from home or the community, instead of producing new ones

solutions.title: Crockery in the office: Avoid Single-Use
solutions.action: Get rid of single-use plastic/ styrofoam cups, plates, cutlery, boxes... Replace them with reusable in the pantries.

solutions.title: Use reusable or compostable crockery / utensils
solutions.primary_option: Consider investing in reusable compartmentalised trays and crockery instead of disposable ones. If you contract your canteen, take a look in the General section at the 'Choose sustainable food service contractors' solution.
solutions.dispensers: Use dispenser for sauces, soft beverage, ice cream, coffee and tea instead of single dose packaging. Allow self service for napkins, bread, sugar, etc.
solutions.alternative: If reusable is REALLY not an option, consider using compostable dining ware suitable for a food waste digester if used. Otherwise, use disposable ware with first lower carbon footprint and then from sustainable sources

solutions.title: Crockery for take away: Avoid Single-Use
recommendations: For take-away meals, encourage your employees to refuse single-use (bag, box, cutlery,...), to bring their own (BYO) reusable containers or use reusable containers app solutions such as Muuse.
Refuse plastic carriers if packed food can be held in the hand.
For BYO, glass, stainless steel or BPA-free plastics are some recommended material options from a safety standpoint.

solutions.title: Buy in Bulk
solutions.benefits: Some products can be found in bulk to limit transport and packaging: coffee, tea, sugar, fruits...It can be the opportunity to promote healthier/ better quality of products, such as organic nuts and dry fruits.
cautions: Make sure you don't over-order and waste. It is usually enough to order for 10%-15% less attendees than planned.
Use proper containers to avoid wastage (e.g. airtight boxes, resealable packaging...)

solutions.title: Grow your Herbs Garden
solutions.benefits: Herbal tea has been used for centuries and has many proven health benefits, depending on the plants used. Mint, chamomile, lemon balm, dandelion etc. can be grown indoor or outdoor in Singapore. Herbs are easy to work with. Once harvested, they just need to be dried and enjoyed. Use this garden to raise awareness about food production.
solutions.resource: Learn more on how to grow different herbs from NParks Singapore

solutions.title: Grow your own produces / Partner with local communities
benefits: reduce transportation of your fresh herbs and other produces
allow your employees to (re)connect with nature
solutions.partnership_benefit: partnerships will support local community gardens and local urban farmers
getting_started: understand your space (lighting, quality of the soil etc)
solutions.alternative: If you cannot grow your own produce, prioritize local produces (labelled if possible)

solutions.title: Raise awareness on healthy habits
initiatives: Provide fresh fruits to your employees once or twice a week (prefer package free, chemicals-free, local products)
Meat consumption contributes to climate change. Encourage your employees to learn more about this issue, and adopt a vegetarian-diet-day once a week. Take a look at Green Monday.

Hold an optional monthly or quarterly potluck to encourage people to eat a healthy, home-cooked lunch. Employees will have the opportunity to share a good meal, strengthen relationships and meet people they don't usually interact with.

solutions.title: Select eco-friendly options for food delivery
recommendations: Select sustainable options such as borrow-use-return systems of reusable containers: with Muuse, you order via an app, receive your food delivery, drop off the containers (boxes and/ or cups) at any partnering venue without the inconvenience of cleaning.
Order from eco-conscious restaurants - it is good for you, for them and for the planet!
When you order food via delivery platforms or directly from your favourite restaurants & stalls, don't forget to specify you don't need disposables such as plastic cutlery, tissue, cups...

solutions.title: Repurpose used Coffee Grounds
solutions.description: Reuse / Donate / Compost used coffee grounds. Coffee grounds are 100% natural and have various practical usage related to gardening, cleaning or technological usage such as fire retardant material. Contract with a specialist to collect them.
solutions.composting_note: If you want to compost it by yourself, be aware that used coffee grounds must be detoxified by composting for a minimum of 98 days for plants to benefit from the potassium and nitrogen contained in the roasted beans.
